===Interrogation, torture and execution===
===Interrogation, torture and execution===

She was transferred to the custody of the [[Sicherheitsdienst|SD]] in [[Limoges]], where she was interrogated under [[torture]], enduring rape and brutal assaults. She was moved eight times to different locations, including Fresnes prison in Paris, Limoges prison and then in late August [[1944]], to [[RavensbrÃ¼ck concentration camp]], where over 92,000 women died. An SOE rescue mission to break her out of the lightly-guarded Limoges prison was planned, but a mere two hours before the attempt, she was moved to RavensbrÃ¼ck. There, she endured hard labour, malnutrition, and exhaustion. She was also held three months at KÃ¶nigsberg (today Kaliningrad) on the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|Russian Front]].
+
She was transferred to the custody of the [[Sicherheitsdienst|SD]] in [[Limoges]], where she was interrogated under [[torture]], enduring rape and brutal assaults. She was moved eight times to different locations, including Fresnes prison in Paris, Limoges prison and then in late August [[1944]], to [[RavensbrÃ¼ck concentration camp]], where over 92,000 women died. An SOE rescue mission to break her out of the lightly-guarded Limoges prison was planned, but a mere two hours before the attempt, she was moved to RavensbrÃ¼ck. There, she endured hard labour, malnutrition, and exhaustion. She was also held three months at KÃ¶nigsberg (today [[Kaliningrad]]) on the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|Russian Front]].
Violette Szabo was executed on or about 5 February 1945 and her body disposed of in the [[crematorium]]. She was just 23 years old.
Violette Szabo was executed on or about 5 February 1945 and her body disposed of in the [[crematorium]]. She was just 23 years old.
